oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluation of the Effects of a Monensin Overdose on Health, Feed Intake, Milk Yield, and Milk Composition in Early Lactation Holsteins
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McClary, David
Kube, John
Green, Howard
Thomas, Elvin
Wilkinson, John
Mechor, Gerald
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monensin
milk production efficiency
mixed ration
overdose
dry matter intake
milk yield
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Monensin (M) (RumensinÂ®:Elanco) is approved for use in lactating and dry dairy cattle for improved milk production efficiency. The labeled dose for M in a total mixed ration (TMR) is 11-22 gm/f dry matter (DM) fed continuously. M is safe for cattle when fed according to label directions but mixing errors can occur and lead to an overdose (OD) and possibly debilitating or fatal consequences. The objectives of this study were to determine the impact of a lOX OD on dry matter intake (DMI) and milk yield (MY), observe the signs associated with a lOX OD, determine if cows acclimated to M responded differently to OD compared to M nai:ve cows, and determine if recovery was affected by inclusion of Min the post OD diet.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2007; 245
